t: Amazon’s Ring to shutter video-sharing program popular with police | CNN Business
s: January 24, 2024 - Amazon’s Ring will no longer let police and other government agencies request doorbell camera footage from within the company’s Neighbors app, in what privacy advocates are hailing as a long-awaited victory for civil liberties.

t: Amazon Business - Fraternal Order of Police
s: August 31, 2023 - NFOP Members can join the NFOP Amazon Business account and take advantage of Business Prime (Free Same Day, Next Day, 2-Day shipping on Prime eligible items), wide product selection (100s of millions of products), and competitive prices (Business-only prices).

t: The two-year fight to stop Amazon from selling face recognition to the police | MIT Technology Review
s: December 10, 2020 - In the summer of 2018, nearly 70 civil rights and research organizations wrote a letter to Jeff Bezos demanding that Amazon stop providing face recognition technology to governments. As part of an increased focus on the role that tech companies were playing in enabling the US government’s ...

t: MPD Amazon Lockers are Available at All District Stations | mpdc
s: July 17, 2024 - The Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) now has eight Amazon Lockers, at all seven district stations and the Sixth District Substation. When residents order on Amazon, they have the option to have their items delivered to an Amazon locker at one of our police stations.
